articles.title: FY22 trade gap with China swells to $72.9 billion
articles.description: In FY21, when India's economy contracted 6.6% and overall imports shrank 17%, imports from China held steady at $65.2 billion, reflecting their stickiness and the surge in demand for electronic goods. These were the key imports from China during the pandemic.
